handNote.desc: Several hands. Compare U3, f10r-f11r and U3, f106r-f107r-f108. Ducler's scribe.

additions.desc:
A paper leaf comes along with the bundle, with a text in French, in black ink, on the recto and on the vers0. Recto:
Mr Ducler, N° 13
intitulé Marcandanâdagame,
ou Tragedie de Marcandeine,
contenant 131 feuilles,
(ouvrage anonyme,) Verso:
Mr Ducler, N° 13
The number is that found in the catalogue of Velanguani Arokium (1845).
BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 397 (front cover, recto).

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to circa 1830 by Vinson (in Vinson et al. 1866-) and to 1830 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably Ducler's provenance). By Ducler's scribe, working around 1830. Probably not before 1828 (date of the earliest internally dated Ducler's manuscript). Not later than its first mention (Burnouf 1832).

provenance.p: Copied for Philippe Ducler by an unnamed copyist in Karaikal Jail. See Burnouf (1832).

acquisition.p: Acquired, July 22nd, 1833, from Philippe Ducler. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1833-1848, no. 82.

Marcandanadagam, ou tragédie de Marcandan, en vers et en quatre actes, représentée à Carical, en juillet 1829 ; 131 feuilles.
Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 57, no. 397.
Velanguani Arokium [Vēḷāṅkaṇṇi Ārōkkiyam]. 1845. Catalogue des manuscrits tamouls de la Bibliothèque royale. BnF NAF 5443. — See p. 14, no. 13.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 92r, no. 369 397.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
